Travel to Singapore

I arrived in Singapore to work with researchers at NUS for a few days and define and start research in some areas in this August/Sept when I will be here for a longer period.

Ã‚Â Travel on long distance flights is niceer now thatÃ‚Â they have much better entertainment facilities.Ã‚Â  I end up catching-up on my movies a bit.Ã‚Â  This trip I saw a nicely made movie about people like me from India in US.Ã‚Â  This movie, Namesake, is really well made and is worth seeing.

I am waiting for the day — hopefully soon — when they will offer Internet also as commonly.Ã‚Â  It is available on very few flights currently.Ã‚Â  Internet should become common on flights longer than 5-6 hours.Ã‚Â  That will definitely make the trips less arduous.

When I t

By Ramesh | June 4, 2007 | Personal | 24 Comments |

  • Conference Non-Proceedings →

24 thoughts on “Travel to Singapore”

  1. Kerry August 18, 2007 at 5:57 am

    You seem to do a lot of travelling Ramesh. Maybe you should get a travel blog. I got a free travel blog at 365.travel.

  2. James October 11, 2007 at 12:19 pm

    Dear Ramesh,

    I agree with you, last time I visited from Singapore airlines from USA the journey was quite long and boring and a person like me who is very much addicted to the internet would be more likely to use an airline who would offer this facility in future.

    I have watched Namesake and its a nice Indian movie.

  3. Javi November 10, 2007 at 6:44 pm

    “Travel on long distance flights is niceer now that they have much better entertainment facilities”. I agree 100% with you Ramesh.
    Best Regards from Rome.
    Coliseo Roma

  4. Dubai April 16, 2008 at 10:16 pm

    Travel on long distance flights is niceer. I do agree but sometimes traveling long distance is makes me bored. I never been in singapore, but i wish someday i can go there.

    Wish you Luck
    Jon

  5. Agnes August 26, 2008 at 8:51 pm

    Hi, we are from a4trip, creating and producing online travel guidebook. We aimed to help travellers with comprehensive destination guides. Currently, we have newly launched few travel guidebooks include Siem Reap, Phnom Penh,Beijing,and Yogyakarta!

    Singpore travel guide will be launched in 2 weeks..! Check it out!

    Do not hesitate to visit us and leave your valuable comments! Hope it will helps in your next travel!
    Thanks! ðŸ™‚

  6. marvic October 1, 2008 at 5:21 am

    Hey Ramesh

    Did you really spoiled your trip by watching Namesake?

    I can’t believe this.

  7. Asia Travel October 31, 2008 at 4:00 pm

    Internet is supposed to becoming available on Singapore Airlines. You should check it out.

  8. Asia Vacation February 6, 2009 at 4:26 am

    Yes, Ramesh, long-haul flights can be very boring, uncomfortable and tiring. Crammed in your narrow seat in economy is not one of my more pleasant experiences. And Internet access would definitely be a welcome addition. Not so much for work, but there’s always a question I want answered when I’m trying to relax. And with the Internet you can have your answers at your fingertips. I’m very fortunate to live in Thailand at present, so the flight to Singapore is only 2 or 3 hours or so. Long enough though to enjoy some time at the fabulous Changi airport after the flight ðŸ˜‰

  9. Jim Rayner March 2, 2009 at 12:28 am

    Good luck with your trip, Singapore is beautiful. Check out my blog if you ever head to Hawaii: Shipping A Car To Hawaii

  10. house sitting junkie May 20, 2009 at 10:06 pm

    I agree long trips are boring and the thing about the movies is the small screen. Maybe I’m just spoilt with the big screens at home? Also when you travel a lot like me you have seen all the movies they show. So Internet on a flight would be a great distraction.

  11. Singapore Flights May 25, 2009 at 11:22 pm

    yes I agree Ramesh, you can search out good options before flying any where

  12. Imran Khan May 26, 2009 at 1:20 am

    Ramesh,
    Long distance flying is getting better these days, provided you choose wisely before booking your flights.
    For easy and cheapest booking you should book with the dedicated sites like: Cheap Flights to Singapore

  13. cheap flights May 27, 2009 at 10:55 am

    more and more airlines are offering wifi on flights. thank goodness for that. it’s great for the business traveler. i know southwest airlines offers free wifi on their flights.

  14. Tom June 7, 2009 at 2:01 am

    Looking forward to the wifi on flights! We’re on a round the world trip, and some of the really long flights (14hrs+) are stupidly tedious.. I’ve been keeping a I got a free travel blog at Round My World..

    Yes it is my own site, I’m building it as an advice site for all travelers. If you have a story, or a blog – please don’t hesitate to submit it and expand the world’s view of itself!

  15. Turism June 7, 2009 at 9:11 am

    All airlines should offer Internet connections. But we know that’s not quite true.

  16. Susan June 12, 2009 at 5:50 pm

    I travel a lot for work and experienced many airlines. Although not the Event co ordinator, I have also booked my own trips over the internet.

    The inflight entertainment is much better, if you have a few good movies to watch, time flies. I have not used the internet on any of my flights. I have my laptop but use the time for reading or catching up on films.

    What the airlines really need to look at improved seating.

  17. BB Blackpool June 22, 2009 at 3:13 am

    Enjoy your trip to Singapore. I used to live there many years ago when the British still maintained a Naval presence in South East Asia and it is a lovely island.

    In response to your query I think some of the major airlines may be about to trial in flight internet. I thin Virgin already do in flight calls so this would be the next natural progression.

    It won’t be without a significant cost I wager though as the traffic will have to routed through satellites.

  18. hery August 2, 2009 at 7:44 am

    I wonder if I have much time to travel like you…

  19. Tartar August 22, 2009 at 1:25 pm

    Singapore Airlines used to offer in-flight internet on some of their flights but discontinued it because Boeing, the vendor, shut down the platform after failing to make any money at it. For the last few months Singapore was offering it absolutely free on their Boeing-aircraft long-haul flights which was great.

    I believe they plan to offer a similar service again when one is available but they’re probably a little reluctant to get into anything without careful research as they got burned on this one.

    Another option is to just take it easy on the flight. Budget Airlines don’t offer these fancy amenities but you’ll save so much money you might not even mind.

  20. Patrick September 23, 2009 at 3:19 am

    I never used the services of SA. Not even for a goedkoop weekendje weg.

    I always book Malaysia Airlines. But the next time I visit Asia I will pay an extra $100 and fly SA

  21. MrPJH October 10, 2009 at 12:07 am

    I believe they plan to offer a similar service again when one is available but theyÃ¢â‚¬â„¢re probably a little reluctant to get into anything without careful research as they got burned on this one.

  22. Linda February 27, 2010 at 1:10 am

    I like long-haul flights. It’s a good time to think about your time, your travel, your life…

  23. Nemanja May 16, 2010 at 8:24 am

    howdy there, i just stumbled your web portal listed on google, and i would like to tell that you compose exceptionally good via your site. i am actually impressed by the way that you compose, and the content is outstanding. in any event, i would also love to know whether you would like to exchange links with my site? i will be more than willing to reciprocate and drop your link off in the link section. anticipating for your answer, i would like to convey my appreciation and have a great day!
    cheap flights

  24. Gina "Travel" Kalandani July 14, 2010 at 7:25 am

    Namesake is a great movie… When I was on a trip visiting Singapore (via Dheli) I traveled on a long flight and ended up zoing out to about 4 different films, and caught up on what I had lost. That’s why I like traveling and visiting different places. Each destination always has some unique places to see, and the trip there isnt bad either!

    Oops looks like ‘travel to singapore’ is an old post ðŸ˜¡
